bibl.title: Despatch from Daniel R.B.Upton to Lewis Cap, December 31, 1859
Despatches from United States Consuls in Boma, 1888-1895
bibl.publisher: National Archives and Records Service General Services Administration

div1.p: Commercial Agency of the United States at Bathurst 31st January 1859

Sir,
I have the honor herewith to transmit. The Quarterly Statement of Seas received by me up to the 31st of December 1858.

It is with the permission of the Collect of Customs; granted upon the understanding that on Evequation is for the upcoming, and unRuoron to the local COlonial Government, that I have been allowed to retain the Papers of American Vessels and thereby collect this to the fees conquest thereto.
I have the honor to be, Your most obdt. Servant Daniel R.B. Upton U.S. Commercial Agent
